title: Amazon affiliate links for all eligible posts
description:
Add Amazon affiliate links to ~414 posts that don't have them. Pilot batch of 20 done (12 links found, 60% hit rate). Remaining 414 posts split into 21 batches of 20. Results tracked in amazon_links.md. Tracking ID: herb-hugo-20. Post list: amazon_links_remaining_posts.txt

## Workflow
1. Read the batch's line range from amazon_links_remaining_posts.txt to get post filenames
2. For each post: read content from site/content/posts/<filename>, identify up to ONE specialty ingredient, book, or kitchen tool worth linking (skip common grocery items, perishables, travel/meta posts)
3. Use WebSearch to find an Amazon product link for the item
4. Append a row to amazon_links.md with: post slug | anchor text | product name | Amazon link with ?tag=herb-hugo-20 (or 'skip — reason' if no good match)
5. Use subagents (Task tool) to process posts in parallel for speed

## Important rules
- Do NOT insert links into blog posts yet — that's a separate future step
- Do NOT commit or push — just update amazon_links.md
- Each post gets at most ONE link — pick the most interesting/unique product
- Skip posts that are travel, meta, announcements, or only use common ingredients
- Always include tag=herb-hugo-20 in Amazon URLs
- Batches 1-4 (lines 1-80) are DONE. Next up is batch 5 (lines 81-100)

## Resuming after context clear
Run 'bd show herbvivoracious-migration-1ad' to see this workflow, then 'bd ready' to find the next batch. Check amazon_links.md to see where you left off.
close_reason: All 414 posts processed across 21 batches. Results in amazon_links.md (440 lines). Links not yet inserted into posts.
